article.headline: Howard 75, St. Francis, Pa. 69
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP) -- Eugene Myatt scored 15 points, and Will Gant hit a crucial 3-pointer with 35 seconds left, to lead Howard to a 75-69 victory over St. Francis, Pa., on Monday night. Gant sank a 21-footer from the left wing on Jeron Smth's kickout, giving the Bison a 71-69 lead. Smith and Myatt each sank a pair of free throws in the final seconds as Howard preserved its second consecutive win. Darryl Hudson added 17 points for the Bison (3-3). Devin Sweetney tied a career-high with 20 points for the Red Flash (2-2), which lost its second straight contest and first road game of the season. J.R. Enright tied a career-high 19 points, but fouled out with 5:15 to play. Cale Nelson set a career high with nine assists, all in the first half, and hit two free throws late to put St. Francis up 69-68. The Red Flash took its first second-half lead after an 8-0 run, capped by Sweetney's two free throws to make it 59-58. There were seven lead changes after that. The Bison took a 39-35 lead into halftime on Hudson's 10 first-half points, including a 15-footer just before the buzzer. Howard forced 18 St. Francis turnovers and committed just 13.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
